fields.description:
In branch A a file is modified and in branch B the same file is removed. When merging the two branches it doesn't make a conflict on the file. Instead, it seems, the conflict is resolved using "Use mine".

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Merging a modified file with a deleted file doesn't give a conflict.

fields.description:
In SourceTree for Mac 2.0.4 there is no more git-subtree command at SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/libexec/git-core/git-subtree
Therefore Repository > Add/Link Subtree... fails with the error:
git: 'subtree' is not a git command. See 'git --help'.
SourceTree for Mac 2.0.3 works fine.
fields.summary: git-subtree is missing in the Embedded Git 2.2.1

fields.description: The {{Edit Remotes}} dialog should have a {{Test Connection}} functionality to be able to test the remote before adding it.
fields.summary: Test Functionality in "Edit Remotes" Dialog

fields.description:
Dragging individual files into the staging area is fine, however, if I select all files and drag them into staging area, the entire project becomes broken and random files get marked as changed. A ghost file (which is actually a folder) gets added to the index which then cant be removed. 

I can replicate this every time for this specific repository (have not tested with other respositories)

This is reproducible in the latest version of sourcetree (Version 2.0.4 (2.0.4))
fields.summary: Issue with dragging all files into staging area

fields.description: This capability would be really useful to help determine when/why specific code is the way it is. In the old days, we use to change flag a line code so we could track the change back to a particular bug or improvement. This was a burden to do and ugly, but the need is still there. When we used FishEye (a long time ago), we use to have some of this capability.
fields.summary: Want to see the commit history of a particular line of code

fields.description:
When attempting to cherry pick a merge commit, the command fails because there is no -m option specified (mainline parent number). 

Though it may not be possible to automatically determine the mainline parent for a merge commit, perhaps allowing the user to simply select the mainline from one of the parents of the merge commit may suffice.

I think the only other place where this issue should arise is when performing a revert of a merge commit, and there is already a ticket for that issue (SRCTREEWIN-593)
fields.summary: Cannot cherry pick a merge commit

fields.description: This has been happening for a few weeks (was working fine before and I must say iit was awesomely easy to use).  I create new GIT project on my desktop.  Commit my code.  I then try and add a remote.  I "create new repository" and get the "Create Repository on Account" dialog.  When I fill this in and press "Create Repository" sourceTree hangs and I cannnot cancel (need to kil the process).  If I go to bitbucket via the web browser I can create repositories without problems.
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs when I try to create a remote repository on BitBucket

fields.description:
After installing SourceTree, it keeps crashing and producing the attached crash report.

{code}*** Terminating app due to uncaught exception 'NSInvalidArgumentException', reason: '*** setObjectForKey: object cannot be nil (key: remoteProjectLink0.baseUrl)'{code}
fields.summary: SourceTree Frequent Crashes

fields.description:
I'd be nice to be able to configure what happens when double-clicking a file in SourceTree.

Possible options:

* Open file
* View in external diff tool
* Staging/unstaging (Git)

I'd go for "View in external diff tool" because I use this far more frequently than opening the file from SourceTree (since they're usually already open in my IDE).
fields.summary: Make double-click configurable

fields.description: he clone from bitbucket screen forces the use of "-b default" when cloning a Git repo from bitbucket. This means that if you create the repo from the bitbucket website then you cannot then immediately clone it from SourceTree like the instruction page says because the repo empty and SourceTree is expecting a "default" branch.
fields.summary: Unable to clone empty repository from bitbucket (Git)

fields.description:
After the update to SourceTree 2.0.4, SourceTree has problems to show git projects (local workspace) while using the embedded git. When I switch over to the system installed git 2.2.1, everything is OK again.

SYNDROME (on project/repository open):
  * MACOS Message box: "SourceTree quit unexpectedly"
    with "Exception Type:  EXC_BAD_ACCESS (SIGSEGV)"
  * SourceTree Message box with "Error occurred: 'git status' failed with code 11:".
  * No content of the git repository is shown
fields.summary: Problems with embedded git

fields.description: I tried using it for a bit but the usability is now pretty poor compared with before. I'd have to install 2 again to make a list of the problems. I can't believe I'm the only person finding this.
fields.summary: Am sticking with version 17.2. Version 2 usability is terrible.

fields.description:
SourceTree prompted for an update which after installing results in exceptions trying to access repos.

Exception dialog is so large it will not fit on the screen to dismiss it.  Happened to guess that hitting return would click the invisible button.

Exceptions look like something going wrong in the bundle.
fields.summary: completely broken after 2.0.4 update

fields.description:
SourceTree prompted for an update which after installing results in exceptions trying to access repos.

Exception dialog is so large it will not fit on the screen to dismiss it.  Happened to guess that hitting return would click the invisible button.

Exceptions look like something going wrong in the bundle.
fields.summary: completely broken after 2.0.4 update

fields.description:
It would be great to have the ability to rename a stash via the right-click menu.

Currently the two options when you right-click a stash you've created are "Apply Stash" and "Delete Stash". It would be awesome if in between those was an option to "Rename Stash". Otherwise to rename, you have to apply it, fix conflicts if applicable, then re-stash it with a different name.
fields.summary: Ability to rename a stash

fields.description:
This is Kieran's quick response:
"Thanks for reporting that. It's probably because the toolbar isn't using the translated strings - it's a different component. Technically this can be fixed."
fields.summary: Version 2.0.4 in Japanese has some untranslated strings although they are translated in Transifex

fields.description:
Since upgrading to 2.0.4, my SourceTree application menus appear in English, as do the main window's toolbars and several other (but not all) UI elements.

My system preferred locales are French (ca), French, English (ca) and English, in that order.
fields.summary: Last version (2.0.4) broke French localization support

fields.description: When I open a project from the bookmarks, in Log View, the panel containing the list of files and the detail for the commit is always skinny. After I resize it to a readable width, then close and reopen the project, the width reverts to its too-narrow state.
fields.summary: Log view file and summary panel width is too narrow when reopening project

fields.description: When there are uncommitted changes from a "Reverse" and another "Reverse" is attempted, Git does not allow the operation until the uncommitted changes are committed. The error message shown [displays "patch does not apply"|^screenshot1.png]. It would be nice if SourceTree could display a better error message indicating the origin of the error.
fields.summary: Better Error Messages for Reversing Uncommitted Changes

fields.description:
Since your last update (2.0.4), once the application is launched I have a popup  (see attachment) and no repository is open.

I'am blocked in my project, have you a quick solution? Where can I find the previous previous?

Thank you.
fields.summary: Pop up alert and sourcetree doesn't respond anymore

Since your last update (2.0.4), once the application is launched I have a popup  (see attachment) and no repository is open.

When opening a project, a dialog shows saying:

"Git log failed with code 11:"

If I go into 

/Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/bin

$./git --version
Segmentation fault: 11
fields.summary: Crashes immediately at startup; bundled git segfaults

fields.description:
To repro:
 * Cleanly install SourceTree. Do not configure any remote accounts (or, possibly, just take an existing install and remove all remotes)
 * Within the repo browser, create a new git repo in an existing directory that doesn't have one
 * Right-click on the repo and choose "Publish to remote." You should get an error message because you have no remote services configured. All well and good at this point.
 * Switch to the "Remote" tab of the repo browser. Add your BitBucket credentials.
 * Switch back to "Local" and attempt to publish to remote again.

Expected: After setting up the BitBucket remote, it should let you publish to that.

Actual: SourceTree doesn't recognize the existence of the remote until you restart the app.
fields.summary: "Publish to remote" in repo browser does not recognize remotes in real-time

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to customize some of the git settings that SourceTree uses - for example, the number of log entries to try and load, as well as how often to refresh the files on disk.  When loading a "huge" git repository (and likely an hg repository as well) - such as https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev, SourceTree seems to hang periodically when trying to load items in the log windows (the spinning wheel overlay just sits there).  Also - since a full refresh can take a while, it would be nice if that could be configured to happen manually (or at least less often...it appears to happen every 15 seconds or so).

Options like this might be more suitable for specific repositories - rather than system-wide...but even system-wide options to control max number of log lines, and refresh rates would be helpful.
fields.summary: Customizable performance tweaks

fields.description:
I am running SourceTree v2.0.3.
Is there a way to make the local repository browser be sorted in alphabetical order? The remote repository is sorted properly.
fields.summary: Sorting of local repos in the Repository Broswer

fields.description: There should be a way to jump to the current revision or its parent (in case you have made modifications). When you are dealing with a revision far into the past it becomes hard to navigate because you are dealing with a line at the top of the list and one a long way through it.
fields.summary: Jump to current revision

fields.description:
I have a pre-push hook set up that runs unit tests. Sometimes, those fail, and the push doesn't proceed. The SourceTree push dialog stays open for me to inspect what went wrong.

However, I am using a logger in my application that outputs colored logs, using the standard [ANSI escape codes|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANSI_escape_code#Colors]

See attachment for how it looks now.
fields.summary: Add output coloring in git push modal

fields.description:
1. set german as default language
2. change push branch default value to one of the german values (nichts, passende, einfach, aktuell) 
3. restart SourceTree
4. open repository 
5. erorr

--> the german value is set in the global .gitconfig file and can't be read or translated to a working value anymore
(error message see attached screenshot) --> replace german value with an english value --> SourceTree works again.
fields.summary: Translation Bug - Settings - Push Branches

fields.summary: SourceTree 2.0.3 for Mac crashes on launch

fields.description:
GitHub recently added syntax highlighted diffs: https://github.com/blog/1932-syntax-highlighted-diffs

It would be useful to have something similar in SourceTree's various diff views.
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for diffs

fields.description: (It's a regression from 1.8.1) If you are in the log view you can only see the internal diff, there seems to be no way of opening an external diff tool directly. It's possible to bounce to the commit history view, pick the correct file then open the external diff. This is pretty annoying after a bit and it's a regression from v1.8.1
fields.summary: Log view cannot open external diff

fields.description: For unknown reasons I'm unable to download any of Atlassian products (e.g. Jira, SourceTree). The http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/SourceTree_2.0.3.dmg url shows "Backend not available" for my IP: 212.142.84.29
fields.summary: Unable to download Atlassian products

fields.description:
I download a repository https://github.com/project-jedi/jvcl.git and say to me I have 1005 change to commit.
I compare the files seem the same.

I think there is some problem.
fields.summary: Delphi Jedi jvcl repoitory

fields.description:
I'd like a feature or even a separate new app (maybe called Source Forest) that regularly scans all your repositories bookmarked in sourcetree and pulls the history data into a searchable database.

I've implemented something similar for myself for subversion. I found it very useful. 

For example I wanted to know which of 10 projects had been worked on most contiguously and which had the most gaps of more than 15 days at a time between commits.

I also used it to find which of the 10 did not have any commit that recorded adding the file /js/results.js and which one had the earliest dated commit which added that file.

As others have pointed out, some of this functionality is provided by the bitbucket website, but it would be great if it was directly in sourcetree, covered all our repositories no matter where they are hosted, and had more searching/reporting features.

See also.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/239704/feature-request-source-tree-overview-all-projects-commit-filter

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11452648/how-to-search-files-present-in-multiple-git-repositories-and-see-the-history-of-changes-done-for-a-file-in-all-branches
fields.summary: Feature Request: Multi-Repository meta search

fields.description:
If I select a old commit, for example one from from September 15 2011, then right click one of the modified files and choose "Log Selected...", the Log only shows commits from September 15 2011 and earlier. It should show all commits for that file.

Also the Date column in the Search view should show the year.
fields.summary: Log Selected does not show the full history of a file if triggered from an old commit

fields.description:
In a repo with a number of changed/added files, select a number of files and stage them, leaving some files unstaged.

Click on the Commit button.

The commit panel appears with space for typing comments. Focus is (correctly) in the text area. However, the selected file for the "diff" panel will be the top file in the unstaged file list.

*I* always want the first file in the *staged* file list selected so I can start to type my commit message describing those changes. I have already decided I am not interested in the unstaged list.

Every time I commit, you make me click once more than I need to.
fields.summary: Commit dialog - selected file

fields.description: SourceTree has been crashing on every single checkout since upgrading to OS X Yosemite.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on every single checkout

fields.description:
When performing a Git Pull with SourceTree from a SSH remote, I get the following error:

{quote}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree fetch origin 
matching cipher is not supported: aes256-gcm@openssh.com
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
Completed with errors, see above
{quote}

Similar error if I try to Git Push with SourceTree.

*This operation completes successfully from the command-line with 'git push' or 'git pull'.*

The remote server runs {{OpenSSH_6.6.1p1, OpenSSL 1.0.1j-freebsd 15 Oct 2014}}, and its sshd_config constrains the available ciphers to: {{chacha20-poly1305@openssh.com,aes128-gcm@openssh.com,aes256-gcm@openssh.com}}.

I believe that the version of ssh shipped with OS X 10.10 includes the AES GCM ciphers, so it would be great if SourceTree could support that.
fields.summary: Support more SSH ciphers

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:
# Go to SourceTree Preferences and click Git tab
# Change {{Push branches}} from {{matching}} to {{current}}
# Close preferences
# Click push icon
# Current behavior: All checked-out branches are selected
# Expected behavior: Just the current branch shall be selected for push
# Also, if you reopen preferences, the {{Push branches}} setting is set to {{matching}} instead of {{current}}
fields.summary: Disable push branches drop-down in Git tab if modifying of Git/Mercurial config files is disabled in the General tab

fields.description: I select a file to commit in a project.  I click commit.  The view then changes to a more detailed commit window.  Since a recent update (within last 2 months), the view by default shows the changes in the first unstaged file.  This isn't useful.  It used to be the first staged file, which is much more useful.  Commonly you do commit several files, but often just a single file.  I often make multiple edits then go through a brief phase of committing.  At this point, I always look to remind me of what's changed when I'm working out my commit message.  Now, I always see the changes for an unstaged file.  Please can you switch this back.  Super small simple thing, but really helps.
fields.summary: Repair file highlight during commit

fields.description: I have core.autocrlf=true set, and frequently change branches. This may lead to source files having CRLF endings instead of LF endings as would be usual on my platform. In this case, I can not stage individual lines or hunks using SourceTree, and the changes are rejected as "patch does not apply" because of "trailing whitespace". (Staging lines on the command line using 'git add -i' works without problems.) This problem can be resolved by changing the line endings back to LF. Similarly, the problem can be reproduced by converting a file to CRLF and trying to stage parts of it. I would assume that SourceTree could be fixed by checking for the line endings prior to staging patches. (Sorry if this issue has been raised before, I only did a very quick search.)
fields.summary: Patch does not apply when staging lines

fields.description:
I've been spending the past couple years doing a lot of UI development (building my own controls, gesture recognizers, etc).  Many of the commits that I put into my repository are to fix bugs or add enhancements to the UI.  I can spend 20 minutes a day writing commit messages, but invariably, when I go back through the logs, I'm often don't have enough information.  Sometimes this is because of context.  Trying to remember the big picture from 6 months ago is hard.

When I do my testing, a lot of it is broken into small use cases.  I think it would be just about invaluable if I could go back and *watch* the use case that was being enabled or fixed.  Sure, I could go through the hassle of putting a bug report together for every checkin and then attaching the video to it, but that's a lot of noise, especially when a lot of work is done on branches.  Its also duplicative - and a pain to track down when I want to look at the logs.  I could also checkout an old copy of my repository (which I often do), but this is error prone (did I rerun the use case exactly?), and tedious.  

If a picture's worth a thousand words, wouldn't it be great to be able to include one (or a video) alongside some words.

My guess is that I would want this to be stored semi-detached from the rest of my repository.  I wouldn't want to *require* another user to take all of this multimedia content too - and considering that it isn't versioned, it might not even make sense in git.  On the other hand, if it could be stored maybe in an adjacent repository somehow, maybe that would be a good compromise.

I realize that implementing something like this is all over the place - and one could argue that it should have either been in git/hg to begin w/ or not at all (though given that they're command line centric, this seems unlikely to be a super compelling need).  It seems like a front-end like SourceTree could really simplify it and unify a lot of logs/commit editors together to give a really great use case.  I really like using SourceTree and would love to be able to get more reliable histories while still being able to use it!

If you have another idea on how to easily integrate this sort of log enhancement, please advise, and I can follow up elsewhere.  Thx.
fields.summary: Allow commits to attach screenshots/video captures...

fields.description:
I have wound up with multiple branches all at HEAD due to various integration activities.
It would be nice to specify which branch I want to checkout, but SourceTree does not provide any clean way to do this from the UI, and I have to resort to going to the command line.
Which also means I have to remember the git command line for switching to the branch that I want.
fields.summary: Allow user to select branch to checkout

fields.description: iTerm/iTerm2 integration no longer works in SourceTree
fields.summary: iTerm/iTerm2 integration no longer works

fields.description:
When I click the "Push" button in the toolbar, I get a form that lets me select branches to push.  There's a table listing my branches.

The first and fourth columns have checkboxes, and the columns themselves are not resizable.  Each one is so narrow that only 2 characters of the header can be seen (or only 1 character, if you happen to sort by that column).  There's no tooltip or any other way to see the entire text, AFAICT.

The first one is "プッ..." (probably "プッシュ", or something that starts with that).

It would be really great if the columns were big enough to show the header labels, or at least were resizable so that I could make them bigger myself.
fields.summary: Columns are too narrow to read in Japanese localisation on push form

fields.description:
It would be nice if the tags in the sidebar of SourceTree were sorted numerically or if there were a preference for this.  For example, tag v2.1.142 comes after tag v2.1.2, but it does not show up that way in the list.  It should be listed like:

v2.1.2
v2.1.142

instead of how it is currently:
v2.1.142
v2.1.2


Also if there were a preference to sort the tags in reverse order, so yo can see the newest ones up top.
fields.summary: Sort Tag names by numerical value

fields.description:
I have a build process which tags successful builds (which is nice).  I like to sync the tags so that I can find them using the left-hand column in SourceTree (under "Tags").  However, when viewing the log for a given branch (using Git, but I'm guessing the same would be for Mercurial), then the tags take up the full width in the Description field (See attached screenshot).

I would suggest placing the tags (and the HEADs and all the other "tag-like" values) in a separate column - that can be reordered and/or hidden as needed.
fields.summary: Ability to hide tags in log view

fields.description:
After changing the default push preferences from "matching" to "current" (german=aktuell) with the german language package. Sourcetree throws an error.
After changing the preference in gitconfig-file it says:

[push]
	default = aktuell

Actually I don't want to change the .gitconfig manually.
fields.summary: Preference for Git push branches in german

fields.description: It would be nice if the currently selected branch was indicated in some way, like making the branch label bold.
fields.summary: Highlight current HEAD branch

fields.description:
When trying to register SourceTree, I get this error after typing my email address (correctly):

Could Not Check User Exists
Parser failed with error

Which is unfortunate, since I'm re-installing my OS and have previously registered SourceTree with this very account.
fields.summary: Can't register SourceTree due to "parser fail"

fields.description:
It would be really good to create an API or some kind of Proxy or just a possibility to run script to allow to create preview by users of arbitrary files. For example if we have a *.dat file from which SourceTree can't create preview then outside plugin could create this preview via some API.

It would be good to create some kind of possibility to run a script or API that can take the file f.e. as stdin and generate png graphics or pure text as stdout that then will be displayed by SourceTree as preview.

Thus, in theory community will be able to create plugins that will add new Preview possibilities.

That would be really helpful and also should remove some effort from SourceTree team! Thanks.
fields.summary: Preview any file type via Proxy/API

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Close SourceTree application
# Run the following command to clear SourceTree configuration:
{noformat}
rm -R ~/Library/Application\ Support/SourceTree/
defaults delete com.torusknot.SourceTreeNotMAS
{noformat}
# Confirm that Git config username and email are set:
{noformat}
git config --global user.name "Kah Loun Foong"
git config --global user.email klfoong@atlassian.com
{noformat}
# Start SourceTree
# After installation, open SourceTree Preferences
Full Name and Email address are empty in General tab
# Without modifying anything, close the Preferences
# Check Git config username and email:
{noformat}
git config --global user.name
git config --global user.email
{noformat}
It has been removed
# Open SourceTree Preferences again
# Fill in Email Address "klfoong@atlassian.com" in General tab
# Close the Preferences and check the Git config:
{noformat}
git config --global user.name
git config --global user.email
{noformat}
Email is set now
# Open SourceTree Preferences again
Somehow "klfoong@atlassian.com" appear in Full Name instead of Email address
# Close the Preferences and check the Git config:
{noformat}
git config --global user.name
git config --global user.email
{noformat}
Username has been set to "klfoong@atlassian.com" and email is empty now
fields.summary: After SourceTree installation, SourceTree Preferences does not read the Git config for username and email

fields.description: Allow sorting on a per-section basis of the sidebar.
fields.summary: Sidebar Per-Section Sorting

fields.description:
When committing a file, SourceTree will have a popup dialog for Uncommitted Submodule if the file in Submodule has been modified. Clicking the commit button in this popup dialog will show uncommitted files in Submodule.

Somehow SourceTree have this popup dialog even though the file in Submodule is not modified. Clicking the commit button will show "Nothing to commit" message and there is no way to cancel it.

SourceTree should have a button to cancel committing submodule to close the popup dialog.
fields.summary: Uncommitted Submodule showing nothing to commit

fields.description:
"git log --notes=xxx" contains very useful info to changeset. One of the usages
is for cross-referencing HG changeset hash when that Git repo was converted
by fast-export (http://repo.or.cz/r/fast-export.git). It would be nice if that is accessible from sourcetree GUI.
fields.summary: Adding support to visualize "git log --notes=*"

fields.description: When I tick the option "Keep stages changes" when creating a stash, it behaves the same as without selecting the option and removes the changes.
fields.summary: Stash -> Keep stages changes not working

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Make sure that no Remote Account is configured in Repository Browser
# Restart SourceTree application to clear the cache
# Confirm that create remote repository ({{+New Repository > Create remote repository}}) does not work
# Add a Bitbucket or Stash account to Remote Account
# Confirm that Remote tab is working (showing the repo list)
# Create remote repository
There will be a popup window "No Accounts Registered"
# Restart SourceTree application
# Create remote repository again
It is working now

It seems that Create Remote Repository does not work when Remote Account is just added. Need to restart SourceTree
fields.summary: Repository Browser create remote repository does not work when Remote Account is just added

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Add a Stash account (URL http://localhost:7990) to SourceTree Remote Account
# Set this Stash account in SourceTree Remote Account to have SSH protocol
# From Repository Browser Remote tab, clone one of the repository
The popup dialog showing the Source URL "http://admin@localhost//git/TST/stash.git" instead of "ssh://git@localhost:7999/tst/stash.git"
fields.summary: Repository Browser clone from Remote Account Stash using SSH protocol have incorrect URL

fields.description:
According to the TV Guide synopsis of "Highway Of Tears," Episode 6 of Season 4 (S04E06), "Nick is anxious to become a Grimm again in light of the attack on Monroe and Rosalee; at the same time, he and Hank are called to a stretch of highway that acts as a staging area for a horrifying Wesen ritual. Meanwhile, the sudden arrival of an old friend surprises Trubel; and in Vienna, Viktor meets with a completely broken Adalind."
Make sure you tune in to NBC tonight at 9 PM (official ET/PT start time) to catch all of the Season 4, Episode 6 entertainment!

»»Won't be able to catch Episode 6 of "Grimm" Season 4 on a TV? Well, we've got you covered with free online live stream links!


» http://w.atch.me/cY5wic


»http://w.atch.me/cY5wic


Check out a live stream of "Grimm" S04E06 on this NBC free live stream channel online - click here, here or here (one link may work over another due to region restrictions) to watch Episode 6 from your computer!
What should we look forward to for tonight's episode and the rest of the new season? Warning: spoilers ahead!

As we previously reported, "Juliette finally decides to help Nick get his powers back! Question is: will it work? Read on to find out what will happen in this Friday's "Grimm" season 4 episode! Last episode, Nick found out that Juliette has to sleep with him as Adalind for him to get his powers back. Although he refused to subject Juliette into the ordeal, he also admitted to Monroe he's "pissed" that he lost his powers because he did like being a Grimm. 

With Monroe and Rosalee getting a new threat, however, Juliette decided to help him become a Grimm again, even if it means she has to look like Adalind while doing so. In the teaser clip for episode 6, "Highway Of Tears," Juliette will do just that but it seems that the cure won't work. Will Nick ever get his powers back? It also seems that he will suffer another mind-numbing connection with Adalind in the middle of an investigation. Will it put him in danger?

David Giuntoli, who plays Nick Burkhardt previously said in a past interview that he doesn't really know what his character and Adalind's "magical, horrible" connection is. He "certainly can't say how this all ends." Claire Coffee (who plays Adalind), on the other hand, teased, "[it] links them in a way that's going to be explosive come Episode 8.

" Will we have to wait until episode 8 to meet a newly re-Grimmed Nick? For now, viewers will have to watch Trubel defend him from wayward Wesens with her machete. According to the "Grimm" season 4 episode 6 synopsis, "Nick and Hank will get called to a stretch of highway that acts as a staging area for a horrifying Wesen ritual." If his powers are still not back, Nick will surely be in danger in this Friday's episode. Meanwhile, after being subjected to a psychological torture, Adalind finally agrees to assist Viktor in looking for her daughter.

With Captain Renard's mother, Elizabeth, also set on finding Baby Diana, will they be meeting each other soon? The only remaining Grimm (that we know of) in Portland, Trubel, will reportedly get a surprise visit from "an old friend." Whether that friend is the good or bad kind is still unknown."
fields.summary: 4X6|Watch Grimm Season 4 Episode 6 Live. Stream. Replay Full Video S04E06 Free Online

fields.description:
i have a pro-commit hook to check for syntax errors in all files to commit .. pep8 and pylint are executed and they output colored text, which is not displayed nicely inside sourceTree .. it more or less lokks like this:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree commit -q -F /var/folders/51/c44nswx131z57y796hzw8xlm0000gn/T/SourceTreeTemp.tGlEp8 
fabfile/__init__.py:83:16: E702 multiple statements on one line (semicolon)
    import ipdb; ipdb.set_trace()
               ^
[7;33m************* Module fabfile.__init__[0m
fabfile/__init__.py 72 W1401 [34mAnomalous backslash in string: '\d'. String constant might be missing an r prefix.[0m
[7;33m************* Module fabfile[0m
fabfile/__init__.py 83 C0321 [1mMore than one statement on a single line[0m
FORGOTTEN BREAKPOINT @ fabfile/__init__.py:82
Completed with errors, see above


This can be easily improved i bet!
fields.summary: color codes in commit output

fields.summary: Crashing EVERY TIME I SWITCH BRANCHES

fields.description: http://screencast.com/t/vbK45MEUzT
fields.summary: Window resizing causes layout bugs

fields.description: http://screencast.com/t/SfWNCenp557h
fields.summary: UI bugs

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a remote account to Stash server with an invalid credential
# Save the setting
# Access Repository Browser Remote tab
The tab load non-stop
SourceTree is trying to login to Stash repeated non-stop. It can only be stopped by quitting SourceTree app
fields.summary: Repository Browser Remote Repository will load non-stop if invalid credential used

fields.description: It would be great if I could multi select tags on the source list and delete a bunch of them at once.
fields.summary: Allow bulk delete of tags

fields.description: In addition,When I launch Sourcetree you could observe that the description is cut off, I need to expand it every time
fields.summary: Sourcetree Crashes everytime when I switch between projects, branches

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a branch 'production'
# Perform a commit in the branch
# Run the following command in the repo so that it will have ambiguous refname:
{noformat}
cp .git/ref/heads/production .git/production
{noformat}
# Restart SourceTree
# Checkout master branch
# Make sure that the option "Always display full console output" is disabled
# Merge production branch into master branch
The merge fail but there isn't any error in SourceTree
# Enable the option "Always display full console output"
# Merge production branch into master branch
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree merge production 
Already up-to-date.
warning: refname 'production' is ambiguous.
Completed successfully
{noformat}

SourceTree should have shown that the merge have failed and display the error.
fields.summary: Branch merge silently fails

fields.description:

fields.summary: Crashes on OSX

fields.description:
Using the *Commit Selected* option will sometimes leave the *Commit* button disabled.
Steps to reproduce, In the working copy view:

* Uncheck all file selection checkboxes
* Select several files using _cmd-click_
* Click *Commit Selected*
* Checkboxes of selected files are now checked.
* Add commit comment
* *Commit* button remains disabled. 
* The work around is to uncheck then recheck one of your files

You can also avoid this problem if you do not first uncheck all the files in the working copy view, but I find it highly annoying that SourceTree presumes that I wish to commit all my files whenever I open a repository, which is almost never the case.  So, my first action after opening a repo is to uncheck all the file selections.

Since I've been opposed to this dumbed-down checkbox scheme since it was introduced, I must again mention that I still think they are a mistake and demonstrate a major violation of basic UI/UX principles.
fields.summary: Commit Selected option sometimes does not enable Commit button

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a branch "Feature/A"
# Add a commit in branch "Feature/A"
# Create another branch "Feature/A/B"
# Add a commit in branch "Feature/A/B"
Branch "Feature/A/B" is missing from the sidebar

This bug is hard to reproduce. Might need to repeat the above steps for a few times with different branch names to reproduce it.
fields.summary: Sidebar does not list some branches with multiple folder level

fields.description:
A massive memory leak (it took about 2 minutes to fill my 32GB of RAM) when selecting a branch on this repo:

hg clone https://bitbucket.org/sreimers/jfx78-android

It is easily reproducible, here's a screencast on exactly how https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9aU--vWNLaQX2tmdXNhWEdLUDQ/view?usp=sharing
fields.summary: Massive memory leak

fields.description:
If the option "Automatically check for updates" is enabled at {{SourceTree Preferences >> Update}}, SourceTree will perform auto download for latest version of SourceTree and update it when SourceTree.app quit.

When Mac is shutting down, it will quit SourceTree.app which will initiate the auto update. However, before the auto update finish updating SourceTree, Mac has quit the auto update process too and shutdown. This will corrupt SourceTree.app due to incomplete update.
fields.summary: Auto update during shutdown corrupts SourceTree

fields.description:
External Diff somehow stopped working for me. I have Kaleidoscope installed and it used to launch that app. Now it does nothing. Console doesn't show any errors.

Anything I can try?
fields.summary: External Diff not working

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a local repository at {{/Users/<username>/reponame}} and perform a few commits
# Access the repository log/history view (do not close this window)
# Rename the path to the repository to be {{/Users/<username>/reponame_renamed}} in Finder
# Access back the SourceTree reponame window
There are about 3-5 error messages "Path does not exits"

It should have only one message like "Repository has been moved or deleted" instead of multiple error messages.
fields.summary: SourceTree should have only one error message if the repository is moved or deleted

fields.description:
It would be great if the "Remotes" section of source tree would allow to rebase on the remotes. When dealing with multiple remotes, this would simplify the process.

The context menu currently contains:
-Checkout
-Pull
-Diff
-Delete
-Create Pull Request

I would add
-Rebase here :)
fields.summary: Rebase from Remote Panel

fields.description:
Something is jacked with the interactive rebase when using it to squash several commits into one. When doing it through the UI, I get a bunch of merge errors and it just doesn't work properly. If I go to the command like and type "git rebase -i commit_hash", the same rebase works fine with no merge conflicts.

It's not the first time I notice this, it seems to be an ongoing issue.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase is jacked

fields.description:
Crashes almost every time I commit or push
I've attached the logs files
fields.summary: Crashes almost every time I commit or push

fields.summary: Source tree crashes often on my mac

fields.description:
It seems to be related to sourcetree being in foreground. Some operation that is doing automatic updates to the view seems to be crashing.

It mostly happens when it is behind other windows and then moved to foreground by clicking its icon on the Dock.

Tried uninstall/reinstall It did not have any effect.

The traceback seems to be really similar to a recently fixed ticket instead this crashes at a slightly different place in the code.

NOTE: It doesn't crash this much for my colleagues so this may be a configuration issue or something related to a bad working copy of one of my repos. I have 13 repos registered with sourcetree(Hg and git as well) and I am usually working with a bigger one that has multiple git submodules. Please ask in comment if you need any other piece of information.

fields.description: you used deprecated key on plist. Nowadays there are KeepAlive options
fields.summary: deprecated key on plist file

fields.description:
when I run git status does the correct thing. It only shows untracked files that do not match patterns in .gitignore files. attached is a screen shot of the unstaged window in source tree. It should show the same info as git status

see attached screen shot


$ git status

Untracked files:
  (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)

	athena-aide-controller/logs/
	athena-aide-controller/mvn.test.out
	athena-aide-data/lookupdata_tool/
	athena-aide-topology/lookupdata_tool/
	mvn.clean.out
	mvn.install.skipTests.out
	t
fields.summary: the unstaged window does not user .gitignore

fields.description:
When i compile my project i get some of the files changed and source tree is constantly suggesting me to add them to commit. I can't add them to gitignore since they are already being tracked and i can't delete them from repository since without them script won't function.

I tried clicking "Stop Tracking" on context menu of the file, but it tried to remove file from repository, which as i've mentioned not a acceptable in my case.

git has perfect function for that
- git update-index --assume-unchanged <file>
- git update-index --no-assume-unchanged <file>

and that's what really should happen on clicking "Stop Tracking"
Please implement support for assume-unchanged

Without implementing windows with list of ignored files to unignore, it should take 5 minutes to implement
fields.summary: Implement ignoring tracked files with assume-unchanged

fields.description: When creating a new repository, or adding one, naming it as {{GroupName/RepoName}} should place {{RepoName}} in the {{GroupName}} group.
fields.summary: Place Repository In Group Based On Name

fields.description:
Upon trying to create a remote repository with letters like åäö it fails with the message "null".

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Unable to create remote repository with unusual letters (åäö etc)

fields.description:
Remote repositories browser shows only 25 repositories for every stash project.
All repositories after the 25th are not visible in the list and do not show up when using the search function.

This is the same issue as SRCTREE-2308 which is marked as Closed and fixed in 1.9.2. Issue appeared again in 2.0.3.
fields.summary: Hosted repositories browser is limited to the first 25 repositories in a stash project

fields.description:
In the log view, if you select any commits other than {{Uncommitted Changes}}, you are not able to sort by {{File Status}}, it just defaults back to {{Sort by Path}}.

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to the {{Log View}}
# Select A commit (or multiple).
# In the drop-down, select {{Sort by File Status}}.
fields.summary: Unable to Sort By File Status in Log View

fields.description:
On a large team that is moving to using pull requests for every feature, bug fix, and so on, our commit list on master is dominated by merge commits and this makes it hard to see what we need to see.

When using the command line `log` method the `--no-merges` option provides the desired filter.  

This is a request for a way to turn that on within SourceTree UI (a new filter).  This would help our large team greatly. Thank you!
fields.summary: option to filter out merges from the commit list view; equivalent to --no-merges for log command

fields.description:
See the screenshot:

When resolving a merge conflict you always have the option of choosing resolve using mine/theirs, and that works but it can be confusing. 

Mine implies my changes, but if you use git-flow and choose close feature the branch develop is checked out and a merge is started with the branch you were working on. The problem here is that now 'mine' is changes from the develop branch. And the changes I just made on my feature branch is considered 'theirs'. This results in quite a bit of confusion when merging.

It you be much better if you dropped the concept of mine and theirs and used branch names instead.

Resolve using 'develop'
Resolve using 'feature/new_view'

I see no drawbacks in this and I would find it much less confusing.
fields.summary: Resolve conflicts using mine/theirs can be improved

fields.description:
See the Image:

On the selected line is says "Merge develop_autolayout into develop" and that works as expected.

The line below says "Rebase current changes onto develop_autolayout" but this is not what happens if selected. What it does and what the text should say is 

"Rebase current changes onto develop"

So it is displaying the wrong branch name in the rebasing part.
fields.summary: Wrong text in popup menu

fields.description: In previous versions the Repository Browser Window (Bookmark-Window) displayed each repositorys local path, which was immensely helpful. Unfortunately this information is gone. Please bring the local path back!
fields.summary: Directory Path in Repository Browser

fields.description:
SourceTree doesn't show a normal diff for UTF16 files, instead it shows what looks to be some type of image, possibly it's a QuickLook generated image.

Being able to detect UTF16 files (easy via BOM) and generate a normal textual diff would be nice. Even if unicode text diff is not possible, at least detecting if the file is all ASCII code points and then do a diff of that would be nice.

For example whenever I edit an InfoPlist.strings file I can't view a proper diff and have to use a third-party app such as Kaleidoscope.

Or, do what FileMerge does and have the ability to use a third-party tool to generate textual version of a non-ASCII file (under Preferences > Filters).
fields.summary: Text diff UTF16 files

fields.description:
If the file name contains at least one of the symbols of the Russian alphabet (Only those characters: Ё, ё, Й, й), the files are shown as Not Tracked.

Make Checkout this repository on OS X and the problem persists.
Repository:
https://bitbucket.org/dimon4u/srctree-2759
fields.summary: Status of files Not Tracked
